result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold James Martin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant in response to motion to vacate DNA surcharge.
Defendant's pro se request to vacate DNA surcharge.
DENYING, request to vacate DNA surcharge.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to vacate DNA surcharge.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail, filed stamped 5/21/14.
Also referenced ATN #41004065017314, arrest date 1-31-14, MCSO.

Defendant Harold James Martin in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Harold James Martin in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). (Defendant is serving a prison sentence also.)  Defendant to pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges in full by 4/30/2018 or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.  aw

Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Harold James Martin not in court, in custody.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Court is in trial.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/30/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Harold James Martin not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/23/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harold James Martin in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Harold James Martin in custody.  William Levins for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #02CF3347 that are attached to the complaint.   Sworn for the state:Adam Isleb-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Lamke in court.  Randy Sitzberger for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was not produced from MSDF for today's proceedings. Officer was present.  Court grants one more adjournment.  If the State is unable to proceed on the next scheduled court date this case will be dismissed.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Lamke in court.  Josh Mathy for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced from MSDF for today's proceedings. Officer was present to testify.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Harold James Martin in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Harold James Martin in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
